author: sky.cactus
content: Doing this for all transactions results in a stateless blockchain, but it runs into frustrating problems with shared state resources (e.g., Uniswap).  This model has been discussed, but always dropped because of this.

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: There was a microsoft research paper on parallel evms a while back iirc which produced a 30% (again iirc) so a lot of kinda unsafe work for very little gain

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: I had the idea of annotating the block with which txs can be executed in parallel, but again the big time is spent in fetching the state from disk and updating the trie

author: sky.cactus
content: You could avoid the state reads with pre and post state witness information included in the transaction.

author: sky.cactus
content: A subset of transactions don't operate on shared state and *could* be include with a full witness included in the signed transaction.

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Yeah but that would blow up the block size significantly and it wouldn't be clear what to do with missbehaving nodes, ...
